intro: Securidaca affinis, commonly known as the African stranglewood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is known for its ability to form dense thickets, which can have ecological and sometimes invasive impacts.
